description:
This course provides basic mechanical engineering
knowledge and theory of mechanics of materials, and how
they are used to solve practical engineering problems. The
course includes introduction to statics, concept of stress
and strain, analysis of stresses and deflections in a loaded
beam, torsion of a circular bar as well as analysis of
frames and machines.
title: Strength of Materials
prerequisite:
EG1111 Engineering Principles and Practice I (for Cohort 18/19 & before)
ME1102 Engineering Principles and Practice I (for Cohort 19/20 and after)
